title: Praia Irmao
description: Irmao is a vibrant beach club and wellness center on the Costa da Caparica, Portugal, known for its bohemian-luxurious atmosphere, with handcrafted design, DJs, sports, gastronomy and a focus on art, creativity and diversity, being a place to relax, enjoy the sun, and events to enjoy with music and good vibes by the sea.

At its heart, the brand is joyful and expressive, never taking itself too seriously. There's a sense of playful irreverence and unexpected moments that spark curiosity and delight. Beneath that lightness lives confidence and sensuality of Irmao: bold, rockstar energy balanced with emotional warmth. Family, music, and environmental awareness. Ensuring that Irmão feels inclusive, culturally fluent, and socially conscious.

title: Coura, Naturalmente
description: Paredes de Coura moves with a quiet rhythm — the wind from Minho sways through the trees, the river flows beside granite stones, and voices carry with the unmistakable warmth of the North.

This identity embraces that motion, drawing from the textures, sounds, and natural elements that define the region. It's not a reinvention, but a reflection: a visual and verbal language that feels rooted in the land and in the lives of those who live there.

From the river Taboão to the stone-paved streets, every detail speaks to a place that doesn't try to be more than it is — and that's its strength. The result is an identity that moves gently, confidently, always in harmony with the village it represents. Coura is just Coura, and nothing else.

title: A Designer at the End of the Dream Career
description: "A Designer at the End of the Dream Career" is a self-published book reflecting on the non-linear paths designers face as they begin their professional journeys. Developed in the final semester of the Communication Design degree, it explores the symbolic and practical weight of reaching the end of academic life.

The project began with a prompt: "A Designer at the End of…". Each group completed the phrase in their own way, contributing an 8-page chapter that expressed personal and collective reflections. The task was then to bring them together under a shared theme, The Dream Career: the thrill of starting out, the disillusionment that can follow, and the hope that keeps us moving forward.

A unifying visual identity was created to connect all contributions, drawing from diagrams, maps, and charts as a nod to the soul-searching that shapes every designer's path. Physically, the publication itself is divided into three interwoven chapters, inviting readers to choose their own entry point—mirroring the unpredictable nature of creative careers.

Printed with the faculty's Risograph machine and fully produced by hand—folded, stapled, and trimmed in the design lab—it was released in a limited run of 100 copies, each with a distinct, tactile quality.

title: Morangos Mofados
description: Moldy Strawberries is a collection of stories by celebrated Brazilian writer Caio Fernando Abreu.

The landscape onto which the original book appeared in Brazil included the AIDS epidemic, the final throes of dictatorship, an external debt crisis and economic recession, and a wide range of geopolitical and ecological anxieties.

The book is divided into three main sections and categorized by colors that symbolize the different stages of mold: O Mofo (The Mold) — in magenta; Os Morangos (The Strawberries) — in green; and Morangos Mofados (Moldy Strawberries) — in cyan. With a pop and modernist language, the circles scattered throughout the pages represent the mold and assume a role of authority as they infiltrate the paragraphs of each chapter. The condensed sans-serif typeface is paired with a classic serif, contributing to an identity that is both contemporary and timeless.
This project was created within the Editorial Design class, under the Communication Design program at Fbaul.

title: Moombi
description: Moombi is a creative lab founded by Brazilian architect Rafaela Cecconi. In her own words, Rafaela describes herself "like an amoeba" — constantly absorbing references from all directions in search of her true artistic voice.
This metaphor became the conceptual anchor for the project, inspiring a system of organic forms that express a flexible and dynamic identity.

The visual language was designed to evolve over time while maintaining cohesion, ensuring that brand elements can adapt fluidly across different contexts and formats. The typographic choice complements this approach: a neutral typeface with a subtle touch of playfulness.

title: Aprender Design
description: In 2023, I was responsible for communications at Aprender Design, the largest online design and technology school in Brazil. Together with the team, I contributed to major launches such as Base — a long-term course — and Aprender Design International. Unfortunately, the work remains under NDA.

title: Qalendar'22
description: Qalendar is a digital interface designed to help users stay on top of World Cup matches in a way that is both functional and visually compelling. More than just a schedule, it's a celebration of the event's host — blending bold design with national symbolism to honor Qatar's identity throughout the user experience.
The visual language of Qalendar is anchored in bold typography and a color palette inspired by the Qatari flag, helping to create a visually memorable rhythm across the site.

At its core, Qalendar is a tool to track match dates, times, and group stages — offering a clean and straightforward user experience. The design ensures that key information is always front and center, with smart use of space and contrast to help users navigate with ease. Whether you're checking today's match or planning for the finals, the interface supports quick scanning and intuitive flow.

title: Gerber.Wishes
description: gerber.wishes is a unique index website showcasing my personal wishlist, blending playful typography with creative interactivity.

This project marks my first dive into GSAP (GreenSock Animation Platform), featuring smooth, dynamic animations that bring the wishlist to life. The site offers a window into both his aspirations and his evolving technical expertise in web design.
Live Website: https://www.gerberwishes.xyz/

title: Dump
description: Dump of old, rejected and experimental projects.
